Arizona Scholarships


50-Year Class Gift Scholarship
This fund was established by the Class of 1960 and that they an each successive 50-year class can add to as their 50-year class reunion project. This is a general scholarship available for application to any NAU student that meets the criteria as set by the NAU Office of Scholarships and Financial Aid. more...

A. Bruce & Margaret Crozier Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate attending Northern Arizona University majoring in Physical Therapy. Preference given to students who have a dependant child or children. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

A. Wade Smith Memorial Lecture Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Arizona State University full-time. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

A.T. Steele Endowment Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Arizona State University full-time, majoring in Asian and Southeast Asian Studies. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

A.W.A.R.E. Club Scholarship
Scholarship for re-entering undergraduate students attending Phoenix College on a full- or part-time basis. Applicants must have completed a minimum of 6 credits at PC and have a minimum 2.75 GPA. Applicants must have helped other re-entry students through referrals, volunteering or tutoring. Preference is given to Re-entry/AWARE participants. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Aache-Arizona Association Chicano Higher Education
Scholarship for Hispanic undergraduate students attending Mesa Community College. Number of awards may vary. more...

Aaron Macy Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student who is a junior or senior attending Northern Arizona University full-time, majoring in Art, with an interest in Ceramic Arts. Preference given to students involved with wood firing, but are also attentive to all facets of the ceramics program. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Academic Excellence Scholarships For Non-Traditional Students
Scholarship for non-traditional undergraduate students attending Northern Arizona University. Award is funded from the sale of Northern Arizona University license plates. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Acmrs Endowment Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Arizona State University full-time, majoring in Medieval and Renaissance Studies. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Acmrs Undergraduate Student Book Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Arizona State University, majoring in Medieval and Renaissance Studies. Award is to be used for book expenses. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Actuarial Quasi Endowment Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Arizona State University full-time, majoring in Actuarial Science. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Actuarial Sciences Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Arizona State University full-time, majoring in Actuarial Science. Award can be used for examination fees, study materials, professional meetings snd student research related to actuarial science. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

Adrian Vandeverde, Jr. Memorial Scholarship In The Sciences
Annual award for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona majoring in the Sciences. Students must be graduates of Tucson, Arizona high schools. Due date may vary. more...

Advanced Education Nursing Traineeships
Scholarship for graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona College of Nursing. Students must be preparing to become Nurse Practitioners or Nursing PhDs. Due dates are June 1st for the fall semester and January 15th for the spring semester. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

African American Studies Fellowship-Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Arizona State University full-time, majoring in African American Studies. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

African American Unity Coalition
Scholarship for African American undergraduate students attending Mesa Community College. Applicants must be involved in the African American Unity Coalition of MCC, have a minimum 2.5 GPA and participate in volunteer activities. Number of awards may vary. more...

Afrotc-Aerospace Studies Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Arizona State University full-time, majoring in Aerospace Studies. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Agbayani-Balintee Nursing Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona College of Nursing. Preference given to students with an interest in emergency room nursing. Consideration given to financial need. Due dates are June 1st for the fall semester and January 15th for the spring semester. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Agcat Open Student Scholarship Endowment
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona College of Agriculture and Life Sciences. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Aggie House Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona College of Agriculture and Life Sciences. Students must be new members of the Aggie House, have work experiecne, been active in the 4H Club, FFA, and/or other school and service activities, and demonstrate financial need and academic achievement. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Renewable. more...

Agnus T. Johnson Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for Arizona resident who is an undergraduate junior or senior attending Northern Arizona University majoring in Forestry. Applicant must have demonstrated financial need. more...

Agricultural Engineering Irrigation Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona College of Agriculture and Life Sciences majoring in Agricultural and Biosystems Engineering. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Aida Estellean Wick Scholarship
Annual award for Hispanic undergraduate students who are planning to attend, or currently attending, Cochise College in Arizona. Applications are made through the Adult Basic Education Staff. more...

Air Force College Scholarship
Scholarship for entering freshmen students attending Northern Arizona University, enrolled in the Air Force ROTC program. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and meet other Air Force qualifications. Must apply during June to December of high school senior year. Award amount is equal to full in-state or out-of-state tuition along with $650 book allowance and a monthly stipend of $250-$400. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Air Force Reserve Officers Training Corps (Afrotc) Professional Officer Incentive Scholarship
Scholarship for 2nd semester freshmen and sophomore students attending Northern Arizona University, enrolled in the Air Force ROTC program. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and meet other Air Force qualifications. Due date and number of awards varies. Tuition amount varies, but includes a monthly stipend of $250-$400. more...

Aisec Assistantship
Scholarship for AISEC members who are incoming students at Thunderbird, The Garvin School of International Management pursuing studies in International Business Management. Students must have been members for at least one year and serve in a leadership role at the local, national, or international levels. Awards stipulate a work requirement assisting either faculty or adminstrators in assigned projects. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Al & Viola Madrid Endowed Scholarship
Annual award for incoming freshmen students accepted to Arizona State University full-time, enrolled in the College of Liberal Arts and Science. Applicant must be a first generation college student(neither parent earned a four-year degree). Candidate must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and financial need (per FAFSA application). Due date varies. more...

Albert & Leslie Farrington Foundation Scholarship
Scholarship for Arizona residents who are undergraduate students attending Arizona State University full-time. Applicants must have a minimum 2.0 GPA and demonstrated financial need (as determined by submission of FAFSA application). Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable. more...

Albert Anavy & Frank M. Chambers Memorial Scholarships
Scholarship for college seniors enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona Department of French and Italian majoring in French. Students must demonstrate academic achievement and be pursuing a career teaching French. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Albert Halderman Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona College of Fine Arts School of Theatre Arts. Students must be participating in performances and/or productions sponsored by the College of Fine Arts. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Albert K. Dobrenz Endowment For Student Support Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Plant Sciences Department. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Alberta And Leslie Farrington Foundation Fund
This fund was established to provide scholarships for NAU students on the basis of financial need, merit, and grades. more...

Alexander & Vivian Gentleman Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Arizona State University full-time, majoring in Communications. Applicant must have achieved academic excellence. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Alfred C. Knight Scholarship
Scholarship for outstanding graduating high school seniors from an Arizona high school who are accepted to Arizona State University full-time, majoring in Mathematics or the Sciences. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Alfredo Vea, Jr. Foundation Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Mesa Community College. Applicants must have financial need. Students must submit the financial need application. Number of awards may vary. more...

Alice Luhtala Steele Memorial Softball Scholarship
Scholarship for Maricopa County, Arizona residents who are female undergraduate students attending Mesa Community College participating in womens softball. Applicants must enroll in a minimum 12 credit hours, have financial need and have a minimum 2.0 GPA. Number of awards may vary. more...

Alice P. Chancellor Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for Arizona residents who are graduating seniors from Cochise County High School planning to attend Cochise College in Arizona to major in Nursing. Candidates must have a minimum 2.0 GPA and financial need. Renewable. more...

Alice Paul Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona College of Education. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, financial need, and be graduates of Tohono Oodham Community College. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Allen Howey Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Phoenix College who have graduated from the Phoenix College Achieving a College Education Program. Number of awards may vary. more...

Alsie French Schulman & Edmund Schulman Memorial Scholarship

Althea Rautenberg Smith Endowment Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen students accepted to Arizona State University full-time, majoring in Education. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Altrusa Club Of C-M-T Marion Chandler Award
Scholarship for female re-entry students who are sophomores attending Mesa Community College. Applicants must have financial need, have a minimum 3.0 GPA and have completed a minimum of 30 credit hours. Number of awards may vary. more...

Alumni & Friends Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Mesa Community College. Applicants must have financial need. Number of awards may vary. more...

Alumni Board Scholarship
This fund is primarily used to support the educational endeavors of NAU Alumni spouses and children who meet the following criteria: High school seniors in the top twenty percent of class or college transfer students or currently enrolled NAU students; and a minimum 3.0 GPA. Spouses and children of NAU alumni and past recipients will receive preference. more...

Alumni Councils Dean John L. Taylor Endowed Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona College of Education. Students must have financial need. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Alumni International Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate sophomore, junior or senior students attending Arizona State University full-time, with a declared major in the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences. Applicant must have a minimum 3.2 GPA and plan to study or travel abroad. Primary consideration given for merit, however, financial need may be considered. Preference will be given to international programs sponsored by ASU; also for programs of three months in duration. Recipient will make a short presentation to the Alumni Chapter Board either at a regular meeting of the Board or the Scholarship Fundraiser, following their travel. more...

Alumni Scholarship For Undergraduate Academic Achievement In Anthropology
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Arizona State University, majoring in Anthropology. Applicant must have high academic achievement. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Alvin & Agnes Tidwell Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Northern Arizona University full-time, majoring in Elementary Education. Award amount varies. more...

Amalio M. Suarez Memorial Assistantship
Scholarship for entering students at Thunderbird, The Garvin School of International Management pursuing studies in International Business Management. Students must have majored in Spanish. Awards stipulate a work requirement assisting either faculty or adminstrators in assigned projects. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Amelia Maldonado Endowed Scholarship
Scholarship for Mexican descent undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona College of Education majoring in Elementary Education. Students must have financial need. Preference given to U.S. citizens who are graduates of an Arizona high school. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Amelia Maldonado Endowed Scholarship
The Amelia Maldonado Endowed Scholarship is available to students at the University of Arizona, College of Education. You must be of Mexican descent and be majoring in elementary education to qualify for this award. Preference is given to students who are graduates of Arizona high schools and are U.S. citizens. more...

American Association Of University Women-Douglas, Az Branch Scholarship
Scholarship for graduates of Douglas High School who are full-time undergraduate students attending Cochise College and are majoring in Mathematics, Science, or Liberal Arts. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and career objective of classroom teaching. Preference given to applicants who will be returning to teach in the Douglas school system. more...

American Chemical Society (Acs) Scholars Program
Scholarship for African American, Hispanic/Latino or American Indian undergraduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona Department of Chemistry majoring in Chemical Sciences and Chemical Technology. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

American Dental Hygienists Association Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students attending Northern Arizona University, majoring in Dental Hygiene. Applicants must complete and submit the FAFSA paperwork. Candidate must have financial need. Graduates of certified Associate Degree program are eligible only if can provide evidence of acceptance as full-time bachelors degree candidate. Licensed dental hygienists who have a B.A. or can provide evidence of acceptance as full-time masters degree candidates are also eligible. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

American Society Of Military Comptrollers Scholarship
Scholarship for college sophomore currently attending Cochise College majoring in Accounting, Financial Management or Business. Applicant musthave a minimum 3.0 GPA and financial need. more...

Amos H. Dudley Scholarship
Annual award for Arizona resident who is an undergraduate junior or senior attending Arizona State University full-time. Applicants must have graduated from an Arizona high school; have a minimum 2.5 GPA; have financial need; and demonstrate potential to continue with their college career by remaining in good standing with the University. Preference given to students of African-American descent. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Annual award for undergraduate junior or senior attending Arizona State University full-time, majoring in English in the College of Liberal Arts & Sciences. Student must submit one short story of up to fifteen (15) pages in length to the Department of English office. more...

Andrew P. Martin Scholarship
Scholarship for a Tucson, AZ resident who is a graduating high school senior planning to attend Pima Community College to study Air Conditioning, Automotive, Construction, Drafting, Graphic Technology, Machine Tool Technology or Welding. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Andria Ligas Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona Honors College. Students must have financial need and demonstrate achievement in a minimum of two of the following: visual arts, theatre arts, foreign languages, linguistics, triathlon competition, and cross country running. Number of awards and award amount may vary. An essay must be included with application packet. more...

Ann E. Buman Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students attending Arizona State University full-time. Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA; have financial need; and demonstrate potential to continue with their college career by remaining in good standing with the University. Preference given to students whose primary residence for five previous years was in Pawnee County, Nebraska or any part of the State of Nebraska. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Anna Catherine Ryan Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Northern Arizona University full-time, majoring in Mathematics, Physics, or Astronomy. Preference given to female students, juniors or seniors. Applicant must have scholastic merit, a minimum 3.0 GPA and financial need. Award amount varies. more...

Anne N. Ingram Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Northern Arizona University enrolled in the School of Forestry. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. Candidates must submit an essay of 500+ words. more...

Anne T. Wethington Scholarship
Annual award for an undergraduate sophomore, junior or senior student attending Arizona State University full-time, with a declared major in the College of Liberal Arts & Sciences. Applicant must have a minimum 3.5 GPA and plan to study abroad during their undergraduate education. Primary selection will be merit, however, financial need may be considered. Preference given to international programs sponsored by ASU; however other programs or travel plans will be considered. Preference also given to a student interested in design who has a strong work ethic. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate seniors attending Arizona State University, majoring in Women and Gender Studies. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Aps Scholarship

Archon Fellowship In Architecture
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona School of Architecture. Students must have earned a Bachelors in Architecture degree from an American university, have a minimum of two years experience in a registered architects office in the US, and plan on completing a Masters thesis based on Sonoran desert site parameters. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Arcs (Achievement Rewards For College Scientists) Scholarship
Scholarship for graduate students attending Arizona State University full-time, majoring in Science or Engineering. Applicants must be citizens of the United States and have financial need. Applicants must be nominated by their units. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Arek Dieterie Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Arizona State University, majoring in Physics and/or Astronomy. Applicant must have high academic achievement. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Arellano Scholarship For Survivor Of Domestic Violence
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Arizona State University. Applicant must be a survivor of domestic violence as documented by a letter or referral from a counselor or clergy. Candidate must have a minimum 3.0 GPA (unweighted), have demonstrated financial need, have potential to continue their college career by remaining in good standing with the University. Number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable. more...

Arizona Academic Decathlon Scholarship
Scholarship for entering freshmen students participating in all four regions of the Arizona Academic Decathlon, with Honors, Scholastics and Varsity, that are attending Northern Arizona University. Due date varies. Award amount is partial-tuition. Renewable; maintain 2.5 GPA. more...

Arizona Academic Decathlon Scholarship (Finalist & Top Score)
Scholarship for Arizona residents who are undergraduate students attending Arizona State University full-time. Applicants must be Arizona state first-place team members in the Arizona Academic Decathlon. Number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

Arizona Academic Decathlon Scholarship (Two-Year Participant)
Scholarship for Arizona residents who are undergraduate students attending Arizona State University full-time. Applicants must have participated in the Arizona Academic Decathlon competition for two years or more in the regional or state competition. Number of awards varies. more...

Arizona Alpha Delta Kappa Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student who will be a senior attending Northern Arizona University full-time, majoring in Education. Preference given to females. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. more...

Arizona American Legion Boys State Endowment Scholarship
This scholarship endowment is intended to encourage these top students to attend NAU. This scholarship will be offered to the Boys State Governor. Should he not attend NAU, the scholarship will then be offered to the Lieutenant Governor or one of the two Boys Nation Delegates. more...

Arizona Association Of Chicanos & Higher Education (Aache) Scholarship

Arizona Community Foundation Arts Scholarship
Scholarship for Arizona resident who is a graduating high school senior that plans to major in Art at the Herberger College of Fine Arts at Arizona State University or the College of Fine Arts at the University of Arizona. Student must be a U.S. citizen and rank in the top 5% of their high school class; or attain a 3.25 GPA; or score at least 1150 on the SAT or 25 on the ACT. Submit artistic portfolio in the visual, performing or media arts; history of arts; or arts education with application packet. Renewable. Number of awards varies. more...

Arizona Constable State Association Scholarship
Scholarship for an Arizona residents who are undergraduate students attending Arizona State University full-time, majoring in Justice Studies, with a justice-related career goal. Student must have graduated from an Arizona high school. Applicant must have completed 56 credit hours with a minimum 2.5 GPA. Applicant must have good academic standing and have financial need. Submit copy of current ASU unofficial transcript; copy of unofficial transfer transcript(s), if any; School of Justice & Social Inquiry Scholarship Questionnaire; one letter of recommendation; statement of financial need; and verification of graduation from an Arizona high school with application packet. Number of awards varies. more...

Arizona Family & Consumer Science Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate (freshmen ineligible) students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona School of Family and Consumer Sciences. Students must demonstrate academic achievement, professional excellence, and extracurricular activities. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Students must have completed a minimum of 12 credits, demonstrate academic achievement, participated in the Arizona National Livestock Show, and be planning an agriculture related career. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Applicants must be interested in participating in research experiences with ASU faculty. Due date varies. Arizona Turfgrass Council Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona College of Agriculture and Life Sciences. Applicants who are undergraduates must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and have completed 30 credit hours; graduate students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and earned a minimum of 10 credit hours. Students must have an interest in working in the turfgrass management industry. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Awards stipulate a work requirement assisting either faculty or adminstrators in assigned projects. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Armstrong Family Foundation Scholarship
Scholarship for Arizona residents who are incoming freshmen accepted to Arizona State University. Applicants must be an orphan, ward of the court, in foster care or a qualified independent student. Candidate must have a minimum 3.0 GPA (non-weighted) and have demonstrated financial need. Recipient must complete 40 hours of approved community service per academic year. Number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable; must reapply. more...

Army Reserve Officers Training Corps (Rotc) Graduate Scholarships
Scholarship for graduate students attending Northern Arizona University. Applicant must have completed ROTC undergraduate program. Application must be made not later than the Spring term of undergraduates senior year. Award amount is equal to full in-state or out-of-state tuition along with $650 book allowance and a monthly stipend of $250-$400. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Army Reserve Officers Training Corps (Rotc) Nursing Scholarships
Scholarship for undergraduate students (sophomores and above) attending Northern Arizona University, accepted into the School of Nursing. Due date and number of awards varies. Award amount is equal to full-tuition, along with a $650 book allowance and a monthly stipend of $250-400. Renewable. more...

Award amount is equal to full in-state or out-of-state tuition along with $650 book allowance and a monthly stipend of $250-$400. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Students must have a minimum 3.5 GPA, financial need, leadership qualities, participation in extracurricular activities, and sports activities. Contact students guidance counselor or the Foundation for more information and/or application. more...

Capital Scholars Program Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Arizona State University full-time, enrolled in the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences. Program is designed to train future leaders by providing hands-on training in the public policymaking process in Washington, D.C. ASU Capital Scholars identify specific policy problems during a 3-day field trip to New York City before returning to DC to work on solutions to these problems for their internships. Due date and award amount varies. more...

Center For The Study Of Religion & Conflict-Undergraduate Research Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Arizona State University in Tempe, Arizona full-time, majoring in Religious Studies. Applicants must plan to research the nature, causes and consequences of religious conflicts around the world, with the goal of contributing to their resolution. Candidates must have a minimum 3.5 GPA; and will be paired with a faculty mentor currently conducting research related to some aspect of religion and conflict. Recipients meet Thursday afternoons twice a month to explore the dynamics of religion and conflict. more...

Hotel Restaurant Management; 6. Elementary Education; 7. Public Administration; 8. Home Economics Education; 9. Environmental Management; 10. Vocational Education; 11. Nursing; 12. Speech; 13. Craig M. Shondeck Memorial Scholarship
Recipients of this scholarship must be full-time (12 semester credit hours or more), an undergraduate student, and have a high school GPA of 2.5 or above and maintain 2.5 or above while completing 12 or more credit hours each semester at NAU.
Preference will be given to students who demonstrate leadership ability, involvement in recreational or intercollegiate athletics, generosity, loyalty, and high moral and ethical standards; and who have earned the respect of both their teachers and fellow students. A personal statement outlining the applicants qualities and characteristics is to accompany the application.
First priority will be given to graduates of Fox Chapel High School in Pittsburgh, PA. If no applications are received, priority will be given to students from the state of Pennsylvania. In the event that no students from Pennsylvania submit applications for the scholarship, students who meet the other criteria may be considered. more...

David P. Mcelwain Health Professions Scholarship
The David P. McElwain Health Professions Scholarship will be awarded to a full-time, Junior or Senior health professions or nursing undergraduate student in the College of Health & Human Services. A cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above is required. Applicants must be a U.S. citizen and are expected to pursue a career in the health care field following graduation.
Criteria: Undergraduate majoring in an academic discipline within the NAU College of Health and Human Services.
Enrolled as full-time (12 semester hours or more) student.
Have a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0 (4.0=A) at time of selection.
Must be a U.S. Citizen.
Must be at the junior or senior level.
Following graduation from the NAU College of Health and Human Services, the student is expected to pursue a career in the field of health care.
Must display evidence of commitment to the health care field by either volunteer work or community involvement or similar contributions. more...

Davidson Family Foundation Scholarship

Dawn M. Fenski- Lopez Memorial Scholarship
Established by her husband in memory of Dawn Fenski-Lopez. Dawn began her career as a manufacturing associate with W. L. Gore & Associates, a medical device manufacturer. She spent the next 22 years with the company, eventually working her way up to the role of Foreign Regulatory Affairs Associate. Dawns work inspired in her, an interest in healthcare studies. She decided that returning to school to pursue a degree in nursing would broaden her understanding of the impact of medical devices on diseases and disorders of the body. Her goal was cut short when in 2002 she suffered a stroke which forced her to retire to focus on her rehabilitation. Dawn touched many lives in the Flagstaff community and developed lasting friendships with people from a number of different countries. It is in her memory and her love of life that our family created this scholarship. It is our hope that in some small way we can help others achieve one goal that Dawn was never able to complete.
*Nursing Major
*Full-time Undergraduate
*Demonstrated Financial need" more...

Designed For You Scholarship
Sessions College offers a Designed For You scholarship program. If you are applying for degree programs for January 2015, you may be eligible to apply for a scholarship that would apply up to $3000 towards your tuition. The scholarship is only available for students entering Associate Degree programs in Graphic Design, Web Design, Digital Media, Illustration, and Advertising Design. The Designed For You scholarship offers awards in six different adult learner categories: Career Changer, International Student, 24/7 Parent, Bridge Student, Entrepreneur, and First Generation. To apply for a scholarship, you must meet eligibility criteria and submit a scholarship essay along with general degree application materials by October 15th. Scholarship awards will be announced within two weeks of the application deadline. See scholarship application for details. more...

The purpose of this scholarship is to provide financial support to meritorious students in any academic program at NAU. The recipients must be entry level freshmen, with financial need and a high school GPA of 3.0 or above, either from Flagstaff High School, Coconino High School, or any future high school established in the community of Flagstaff. The second half of this scholarship will be awarded the spring semester provided the student(s) is making satisfactory progress toward a degree after the first semester, maintains a 2.0 or above for the first semester, and is enrolled for at least 12 credit hours each semester. more...

Doran Community Scholars Program Scholarship
Scholarship for graduating high school seniors from the Phoenix Union High School District accepted to Arizona State University full-time. Applicants must have a minimum 2.7 GPA and attend a weekly Pro-Seminar (DCI 194) class during their freshman year which focuses on community service, civic leadership and professionalism. Recipient must complete 40 hours of community service over the academic year; meet with the Program Coordinator for a goal-setting session; attend & participate in a Doran Scholars meeting the first Saturday of every month; attend Doran Scholars Fall Weekend Retreat; and attend the Fall New Doran Scholars Orientation. Number of awards varies. more...

Submit three(3) copies (maximum length is 2 single-spaced pages) of research proposal which must include: 1) an introduction highlighting the research focus; 2) clear statement of the research purpose and hypotheses; 3) a brief summary of methods to be used; 4) expected outcomes; 4) the proposed budget with application packet. more...

Eleanor Joan Kellis Memorial
Established in loving memory of Eleanor Joan Kellis. Eleanor Kellis received her nursing degree from Good Samaritan School of Nursing in Phoenix, AZ. Eleanor enjoyed adventure and helping others. She worked in a variety of areas of nursing and as a volunteer for the American Red Cross and Childrens Hospital. She provided patient care at several hospitals and found her niche in Utilization Review. Joans father, brother, mother-in-law and brother-in-law all received degrees from NAU.
To be award to a deserving nursing student with financial need. " more...

Emily Marie Benson Memorial Scholarship
Preference for this scholarship will be given to an incoming freshman, however other applicants meeting the following criteria are encouraged to apply. This Fund shall be used to provide a scholarship for tuition, fees, and on-campus housing to a student who meets the following criteria.
a) Must be a U.S. citizen.
b) Must be a full-time student enrolled at Northern Arizona University.
c) Has a significant medical condition and/or disability.
d) Provides a resume describing his/her personality, activities, awards, special performance and talents, and any other information that the applicant believes to be relevant.
e) Submits a one-page essay describing how he/she is able to see past the barriers of their medical condition and how it benefits and inspires them to reach their goals and overcome challenges on a daily basis.
I) Submits a one-page letter of recommendation from a teacher who knows him/her very well. The purpose of this letter is to provide information about the person, not their academic background. The letter is to be signed, dated and placed in a sealed envelope and submitted to the Scholarships Office in Gammage building or by mail to P.O. Box 4108, Flagstaff AZ,86011.
g) Submits a one-page letter from his/her current physician describing the applicant, their attitude toward their medical condition, and the specifics of that condition, along with any other information the physician deems relevant.The letter is also to be signed, dated and placed in a sealed envelope and submitted to the Scholarships Office in Gammage building or by mail to P.O. Box 4108, Flagstaff AZ,86011. more...

Flagstaff Medical Center Health Profession Scholarship
Annual award for a Northern Arizona resident who is an undergraduate junior or senior attending Northern Arizona University, pursuing any major offered by the College of Health Professions. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and be a U.S. citizen. Candidate must display evidence of commitment to the health care field through volunteer work, community involvement or similar contributions. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Flagstaff Medical Center Health Professions Scholarship
The Flagstaff Medical Center Health Professions Scholarship will be awarded to a full-time, Junior or Senior health professions or nursing undergraduate student in the College of Health & Human Services. A cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above is required, must be a U.S. citizen, reside in northern Arizona, display evidence of commitment and service to health care and consider working at FMC following graduation.
Criteria:
Majoring in an academic discipline within the NAU School of Health Professions
Enrolled as full-time (12 semester hours or more) student
Have a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0 (4.0=A) at time of selection
Must be a U.S. citizen
Must be at the junior or senior level
Must be a resident of the Northern Arizona region
Following graduation from the NAU School of Health Professions the student is expected to consider working at Flagstaff Medical Center
Must display evidence of commitment to health care field by either volunteer work, community involvement or similar contributions more...

Guy R. Householder Jr. Memorial Scholarship
This fund shall be used to support an undergraduate or graduate student (full or part time) who is a full-time law enforcement officer (being an individual empowered to arrest for law violations) of: 1. The City of Flagstaff, Arizona; 2. Coconino County; 3. or the State of Arizona who reside in Coconino County, Arizona. Applicants are not restricted to enrollment in criminal justice courses.
If in any given year no person meets the criteria (1-3) above applies for this scholarship by March 1st, the scholarship may be used to support any undergraduate student (full or part-time) who, is an incoming freshman having graduated from his/her high school with at least a 3.5 GPA, who, after their freshman year of college, has at least a 3.0 GPA (where A=4.0).
This award will be disbursed one-half for fall semester and one-half for spring semester. more...

Haner Scholarship
Annual scholarship awards shall be disbursed one-half for fall semester and one-half for spring semester to one or more students at NAU who meet the following criteria: have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above after completing one or more years of college as a full time student (12 semester hours or more) OR have an ACT score of 29 or SAT score of 1270 or above if entering as a freshman. Preference will be given to students who have graduated from an Arizona High School and to students who have demonstrated initiative, leadership and high moral character by involvement in school activities, organizations or by part-time work on campus. more...

J. Harold Courtright Scholarship
Annual award for graduate students working toward a degree in the geological sciences at Arizona State University, Northern Arizona University, or the University of Arizona. Students should be working on a field-related project in the North or South American Cordillera. Preference will be given to proposals related to economic geology and the study or ore deposits, but proposals related to structural geology, petrology, geochemistry, geochronology, tectonics, and geophysics will be fully considered. Number of awards varies. more...

K. & G.W. Scholarship
This scholarship was established to encourage and financially assist students seeking a baccalaureate degree that will qualify them for immediate employment in their chosen career field. This annual scholarship will be disbursed one-half for fall semester and one-half for spring semester to one or more students enrolled in vocational oriented programs at NAU who meet the following criteria: Must be a junior or senior, must have a cumulative GPA of 2.5 or above (4.0=A), must be a U.S. citizen, must have graduated from an Arizona high school. Preference will be given to a mature student seeking a second career, retraining, or advance training who meet the other criteria. more...

Lisa Sechrist Lipke
Established by Jean and Gilbert Sechrist, M.D., in honor of their daughter Lisa Sechrist Lipke. The Sechrist family has a long history in the Flagstaff Medical community. Charles Sechrist (grandfather to Lisa), came to Flagstaff and co-founded the Flagstaff Hospital and was a physician-surgeon. Gilbert Sechrist, son of Charles, was a prominent pediatrician in Flagstaff until his retirement. Lisa followed in the families foot steps earning her Nursing degree from NAU in 1995. She has been a nurse in telemetry, medical/surgical and pediatric sub-acute oncology. This scholarship is to honor this tradition and support the health of our communities.
*Enrolled as a full-time undergraduate junior or senior in the BSN program
*Maintains a grade point average of 3.0 (where A=4.0)
*Arizona resident
*Financial need" more...

Annual award for graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona College of Nursing majoring in Geriatric Nursing. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and financial need. Due dates are June 1st for the fall semester and January 15th for the spring semester. Award amount is for resident fees. more...

Major General Earl And Nadia Matthews Military Spouse Scholarship
This fund is established to provide scholarships for military spouses. It shall be used to provide scholarships for spouses of: currently deployed service members (active duty, National Guard, Reserves); Veterans of all wars; active duty service members.
To qualify, recipients must also meet the following criteria: Applied and accepted as a degree-seeking student to NAU and in good academic standing; applied for the FAFSA application, which ensures the student is also making him/herself available for other sources of funding, augmenting the impact of the Military Spouse Scholarship; enrolled in course(s) leading to an undergraduate degree program as certified on the program of study and by the students academic advisor; agree to a beginning, mid-term, and end-of-term/exit assessment contact with the Office of Military and Veteran Affairs, which will also include an end-of-term survey for tracking purposes and ongoing improvement and development of the program. more...

Martha V. Chapman Scholarship
Established in honor of Martha Chapman. Martha was born and raised in Morenci, AZ. She received a degree in nursing from Washington University in St. Louis, MO. A former surgical nurse, she came to NAU when it was Arizona State College (ASC) in Flagstaff, where she was employed as the college nurse at ASC Health Center with Dr. Martin Fronske. She left the University and was employed as a school nurse in the Flagstaff Public schools from where she retired.
*Accepted to the Nursing Program
*enrolled for 12 credit hours or more
*Must have a GPA of 3.0 or better
*Preference is a high school graduate from Northern AZ." more...

Mcdonald-Rolle Scholarship
This fund was established to honor two individuals who were held in high esteem by former NAU students. Both Lewis J. McDonald and Joseph C. Rolle were Alumni of NAU. Both McDonald (1931) and Rolle (1941) served two terms as student body president at NAU in addition to many other activities. Both returned to serve NAU in their working careers. McDonald was Executive Director of University Relations until his retirement in 1976 after 24 years at NAU. Rolle was Dean of Students and later Dean of University Services until his retirement in 1982 after 36 years of service to NAU and its students. Both men devoted much of their lives to young people and the improvement of their lives through education. This scholarship fund at NAU is a particularly fitting tribute to Lewis J. McDonald and Joseph C. Rolle.
This annual scholarship shall be disbursed one-half for fall semester and one-half for spring semester to students enrolled at NAU who meet the following criteria: Must be a full-time student (12 semester hours or more) seeking a degree in any discipline, must have completed sufficient courses to be classified a sophomore or above with preference to undergraduate students, must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above (4.0=A), and must be a U.S. citizen. Preference will be given to students who have been involved in extracurricular activities and to past recipients (past recipients must re-apply for renewal consideration). more...

Nau Office Of Student Financial Aid Scholarship

Nau Retiree Centennial Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide encouragement and financial assistance to full-time or part-time, upper division undergraduate students in good standing.
This scholarship will support one or more undergraduate students enrolled at NAU who shall have met the following criteria:
a)The student must have an cumulative GPA (grade point average) of at least 3.0 on a 4.0=A scale for all college/university course work transferred to or earned at NAU
b)The student shall hold university status of junior or above
c)The student shall have a declared major in any academic field of study listed in the current NAU catalog
d)If applicants qualifications are comparable, preference shall be given to children or grandchildren of NAU retirees
e)The student shall have demonstrated high academic achievement and show promise of continued attainment
f)Selection shall not be influenced by gender, ethnic background, nor financial status
g) The recipient(s) shall be encouraged to submit a letter of acknowledgment to the NAURA and/or appear as a guest at a NAURA meeting to make a brief presentation; and,
h)A student shall be eligible to receive this scholarship only once more...

New England Business Service Scholarship
This scholarship shall be awarded to a student entering NAU who has graduated from a high school in Flagstaff during the same year. The recipient must have a high school GPA of 3.0 or above and maintain 3.0 or above while completing twelve or more credit hours each semester at NAU. Preference will be given to students demonstrating entrepreneurial activities during their high school career. Examples of entrepreneurial activities: Started a small business, delivered newspapers, worked with Junior Achievement, held a part time job, etc. more...

Pizza Hut Of Arizona Scholarship
This fund shall support scholarships to NAU student employees of Pizza Hut of Arizona. To be eligible, students must have been employed at Pizza Hut in Flagstaff the past six consecutive months and worked an average of 15 hours per week. more...

This fund shall be used to award scholarships to non-traditional students at NAU, including single parents, community college transfers, or students who attend part-time through on- or off-campus programs. Recipients must demonstrate academic achievement with a minimum GPA of 3.0 or above on a 4.0 scale. Financial need will also be considered in making awards. more...

Students who work 20 hours per week and are registered for 6 semester hours will have 100% of their tuition rebated and the cost of their helath insurance covered. Scholarship for outstanding undergraduate juniors, seniors or graduate students attending Arizona State University full-time, engaged in studies about Jews or Judaism. Award provides a stipend to pursue a research project under the direction of an ASU faculty advisor. The project results must be presented in a public lecture; awardee is allowed up to one year to complete the project. Submit one-page plan of research; CV or transcript; and two letters of recommendation with completed Jewish Studies Scholarship, Fellowship & Grant Application. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Richard E. Cooper
Preference given for underprivileged, low income or physically handicapped students with appropriate scholastic ability to enter Northern Arizona University, with an emphasis on physically handicapped student.This Fund shall be used to provide a scholarship for a student who meets the following criteria.
a) Must be a full-time student enrolled at Northern Arizona University.
b)Demonstrate Financial need
c) Submits a one-page letter from his/her current physician describing the applicant, their attitude toward their medical condition, and the specifics of that condition, along with any other information the physician deems relevant.The letter is also to be signed, dated and submitted to the Scholarships Office.
Award preference shall be to students who are physically disabled. more...

Ruth E. Nicolls Memorial Nursing Scholarship
Established by the Nicolls family to honor the character of Ruth and her life practices of demonstration of integrity and ethical life choices, while incorporating the ideals of community, commitment and care within the health care profession. Ruth Nicolls taught in the NAU nursing program from 1979 to 2002.
*Undergraduate BSN student at the Sophomore level or above
*Completed the freshman year courses with at least a 3.0 GPA
*Registered for a minimum of six semester hours (12 hours = full time)
*Preference for students who reflect characteristics of ethics and integrity, people skills, volunteer work, community commitment and care, and are bilingual" more...

Science Club Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students attending Cochise College who are members of the CC Science Club. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA, financial need and completed at least 12 credit hours at CC. Preference to students continuing at Cochise or transferring to a university. more...

Scholarship for incoming freshmen attending Arizona State University full-time, majoring in Electrical Engineering. Recipient must write a thank you letter. Preference given to students with a minimum 3.0 GPA. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Annual award for graduating high school student or community college transfer student planning to attend Northern Arizona University majoring in Journalism. Applicant must have meritorious journalistic service at students previous institution and promise of future journalistic potential. more...

Annual award for undergraduate student, with 30 hours completed, attending Northern Arizona University full-time majoring in Advertising, Print Journalism or Public Relations. Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and demonstrated participation in extracurricular activities. more...

Senior Achievement Award
Annual award for undergraduate student who is a senior attending Northern Arizona University full-time, majoring in Biology. Applicant must have completed 90 hours, with 45 hours earned at Northern Arizona University. Candidate must have a minimum 3.2 GPA and outstanding academic achievement. Recipients name will be added to the Departments award plaque. more...

Senior Scholastic Award
Annual award for undergraduate student who is a senior attending Northern Arizona University full-time, majoring in Biology. Applicant must have completed 90 hours, with 45 hours earned at Northern Arizona University. Candidate must have the highest overall GPA, and graduate in the spring semester. Honorees name will be added to the Departments award plaque. more...

Seymour H. Jacobs Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for outstanding undergraduate or graduate students attending Arizona State University full-time, pursuing a Jewish Studies Certificate as part of their course of study. applicants must demonstrate outstanding academic performance within the field of Jewish Studies and have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Award is generally intended for research and/or travel related use. Submit a one-page statement or plan of research; CV or transcript; and two letters of recommendation with completed Jewish Studies Scholarship, Fellowship & Grant Application. Number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Snider Family Scholarship Fund
This fund shall be used to provide scholarships for students who meet the following criteria: first generation in their family to attend college; be financially independent; have financial dependents (minimum two exemptions); minimum 2.5 GPA (A=4.0); provide an essay (1200 character limit) describing career/personal goals and objectives and any special circumstances of which the scholarship committee should be aware.This annual scholarship will be disbursed one-half for fall semester and one-half for spring semester to one or more students enrolled at NAU. more...

Suzanne Ingersoll Scholarship
This Fund shall be used to award scholarships for students enrolled at Northern Arizona University who meet the following criteria:
a. Graduates of a high school in Maricopa County with preference given to graduates from the Phoenix Union High School District, Phoenix, AZ;
b. Must be an undergraduate student;
c. Must be a U.S. citizen;
d. Maintain a minimum grade point average of 3.0 [where A = 4.0]; and
e. Demonstrate financial need as indicated on his/her FAFSA. more...

Turner-Davis Scholarship
Established by friends and family in loving memory of Corine Turner and Linda Davis that were killed by a hit & run driver. During Corine career she was a school nurse for Gila Bend High School for 30 years and implemented the Diabetes Prevention Program on the San Lucy Reservation. Linda, with her steadfastness, helped to build a successful family business and was a beacon of hope with her commitment to serve wherever she was needed. Together they volunteered their time at school and community functions. An annual walk is held in memory of the two best friends. Proceeds are donated to the scholarship to embrace the womens ""Pay it Forward"" Philosophy.
*Yuma enrolled Full-time Nursing Program undergraduate
*Maintains a 3.0 GPA (where A = 4.0)
*Financial need." more...

Wayland Educational Foundation Fund
This purpose of this scholarship is to aid and assist worthy and deserving young men and women students, who are citizens of the State of Arizona, to acquire an education on their own. This fund shall exclude all students whose parents are capable of providing their children with reasonable educational facilities. It is the hope of the Donors that when the beneficiaries of this foundation have reaped material rewards as a result of aid from this foundation, they may feel disposed to aid other deserving students to acquire an education by making gifts or bequests to this foundation. more...

Wolslager Foundation Scholarship
The Wolslager Foundation Scholarship is open to full-time students at Cochise College. You must be a graduate of a Cochise, Pima or Santa Cruz high school or have been a resident of one of these counties for a minimum five years. Additionally, you must be a U.S. citizen, have a minimum 2.5 GPA, and have declared a major to be eligible for this award. Students who are student athletes or who are majoring in any discipline falling under the administration of justice, art, political science, or the Arizona Department of Corrections are not eligible for this award. more...

Woznicki Memorial Scholarship
The Woznicki Memorial Scholarship is available to students majoring in research science at Yavapai College. You must have a minimum 3.0 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Wylie Smith Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Northern Arizona University full-time majoring in Journalism. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. more...

Wynelle Knight Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for diabled undergraduate students attending Pima Community College. Number of awards varies. more...

Y.F. Wu Asian American & Pacific Islander Student Scholarships
Scholarship for Southeast Asian American, South Asian, Southeast Asian or Pacific Islander, undergraduate or graduate students attending Arizona State University, who aspire to higher education. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Y.F. Wu Book Scholarships
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Arizona State University full-time, majoring in Asian Pacific American Studies. Award can be used towards book expenses. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Yaqui Indian Scholarship
Scholarship for Yaqui Indian undergraduate students attending Mesa Community College. Applicants must have a minimum 2.0 GPA. Number of awards may vary. more...

Yavapai College Champions Scholarship
The Yavapai College Champions Scholarship is available to students at Yavapai College. You must be a current or recent ward of the Yavapai County Juvenile Court and have a minimum of 3.0 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Yavapai College Music Department Scholarship
The Yavapai College Music Department Scholarship is available to students majoring in performing arts at Yavapai College. You must have a minimum 3.00 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Yavapai County Chiropractic Scholarship
The Yavapai County Chiropractic Scholarship is available to students at Yavapai College. You must have a minimum 3.0 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Yavapai County Medical Society Alliance Scholarship
The Yavapai County Medical Society Alliance Scholarship is available to students majoring in nursing at Yavapai College. You must have a minimum 3.0 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Yavapai Symphony Association Scholarship
The Yavapai Symphony Association Scholarship is available to students majoring in music at Yavapai College. You must have a minimum 3.00 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Yuma County Agricultural Producers Scholarship (Ycaps)
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona College of Agriculture and Life Sciences majoring in Agriculture, Agribusiness, or an Agriculture-related field. Students must demonstrate financial need and academic achievement. Preference given to Yuma County, Arizona area high school graduates. Number of awards may vary. A resume and personal letter must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable; recipients may reapply. more...

Zachary Scott Bennett Memorial Scholarship
Annual award for an undergraduate student attending Northern Arizona University, accepted into the Physical Therapy program. Applicant must be a U.S. citizen and have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Award amount varies. more...

Zachary Scott Bennett Memorial Scholarship
Must be accepted into the Physical Therapy Program, enrolled as a full-time student, with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 (4.0=A) or above at the time of selection, and must be a U.S. citizen. more...

Zeb Pearce Nursing Scholarship
Scholarship for Maricopa County, Arizona residents who are undergraduate students attending Mesa Community College majoring in Nursing. Applicants must have financial need and a minimum 2.7 GPA. Number of awards may vary. more...

Zelen-Kazz Environmental Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students enrolled full-time at the University of Arizona College of Agriculture and Life Sciences Department of Agricultural and Biosystems Engineering. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Zell Family Foundation Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Arizona State University full-time. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and demonstrated financial need (as determined by submission of FAFSA application). Entering freshmen must be in the top 15% of their high school graduating class. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Zita M. Johnson Child Study Scholarship
Annual award for an undergraduate student attending Arizona State University full-time, majoring in Child Study Psychology. Applicant must have achieved academic excellence. Due date varies and award amount varies. more...
